column3: Go to the DOAJ journal search page at /search/journals
Place your cursor in the Subject search box

column4: A hint to type 3 characters or more to search is displayed
A list of subjects are displayed.  The full tree is shown (with all children expanded), where there is a match somewhere in each branch
Your search string is highlighted in bold on each term where it appears

column3: Delete the last character of your search (so you now have, for example, "Fi")

column4: A hint to type 3 characters or more to search is displayed

column3: Delete the remaining 2 characters of your search, so there is nothing in the search box

column4: The original subject facet content is shown, with a single level of subjects

column3: Select a subject (try one that is several levels deep, e.g. Technology > Chemical Technology)

column4: The subject and any parents are selected in the facet
The facet status hasn't changed - the search query is still visible in the search box and the tree is filtered

column3: Enter another search of 3 or more characters, which will also return the values you selected in the previous step (e.g. "Bio")

column4: A list of subjects are displayed.  The full tree is shown (with all children expanded), where there is a match somewhere in each branch
Your search string is highlighted in bold on each term where it appears
Your previously selected values are displayed as selected within the tree

column3: Select another subject from another part of the tree (e.g. Medicine)

column4: All your subjects and any parents are selected in the facet
The facet status hasn't changed - the last search query is displayed in the input field and the tree is filtered

column3: Unselect one of the subjects you had previously selected (e.g. Chemical Technology)

column4: Your second subject is still present (e.g. Medicine) and any parents of the subject you unselected are still present (e.g. Technology)
The facet status hasn't changed - the last search query is displayed in the input field and the tree is filtered

column3: Enter a long random string into the search box

column4: A message is displayed "No subjects match your search"

column3: Remove a string from the search box

column4: The facet shows all subjects with all levels folded
